review: Went there two weeks ago with the boyfriend and my dad. We were told it'd be a 20-30 minute wait (Typical for a Friday evening), but were seated in about 10-15. Our server was GRACE, and she was AMAZING! Normally I don't rant and rave about specific people, but she went above and beyond! She was patient with us, answered questions, very friendly, but professional. Had excellent recommendations. She always kept our drinks full, and endless fries coming! She even offered to let us try one of their famous sauces, (Campfire sauce?!) and it was so delicious! I have the grilled chicken teriyaki burger with grilled pineapple, and the flavors were on point. MY only two complaints about the entire experience is; 1- Coke products 2- bun got a little soggy-couldn't been a little toasted Ask for Grace if you go to this location!

I remember when this place was first built and my friend who worked here used to dress up as the big Robin mascot! Good times. I had not eaten at a Red Robin since then but I remember the burgers being greasy. This past visit I was surprised by how busy it was, the place was packed. We had reservations for 6 people and only waited about 10 mins. So overall the food was ok. Server was very friendly and efficient. I ordered the Red Robin Gourmet Burger with cheddar cheese. The sweet pickle relish stood out otherwise there wasn't anything special to it. Garlic fries were yummy- wide cut with minced garlic and parmesan cheese. Side of fries served with the burgers was small (~10 fries) but the free refill side was large. Noise level in the restaurant was very loud. At the end they have convenient tablets to pay at the table and even print your receipt. For a low key group dinner it worked great but I won't be coming back on my own anytime soon, just not my vibe and there's too many other good burger places out there.

The burgers here are great. I've NEVER had a bad meal here. The bottomless basket of fries, is ingenious! Our waitress, Shawn, (we've had her a few times) never fails at being the best waitress! She always finds the best deals for us, because we are "frequent patrons" to Red Robin. The bathrooms are clean, as is the restaurant!

I will tell you straight, the burgers are over priced.  The burgers are ok but the patty tends to be thin and at this price they should be a bit more meaty.  I go here usually due to location (that old adage is right on) or a friend wants to go.  The beers can be big, which is good but pricey.  The service was ok, but the waitress was tired and hey, that happens and I don't need a show, but if she would have asked how I was doing would have been nice.  I am not a cheap guy, I can ball with the best of them, but I like a deal - you dig me yelpers, I know you do.

So I ordered it to go... ordered 40.00 worth of items including 2 BOWLS.. not cups of clam chowder.. I didnt even get 1/2 cup worth... see pics... I feel gipped.. the salmon burger was decent .. I ordered from Amazon restaurant delivery and they also did not have the fact the garlic herb fries have parmeson on them and I'm lactose intolerant.. that isn't Red Robins fault I don't think.. more amazons. but it was a bummer..  mostly  they were super cheap on the amount of soup they have in a "bowl" size.. worth near 6.00. definately not worth it for a few spoons ful.

Red Robin has some really nice things to offer. It has a huge menu with a million options, which can oftentimes serve as a red flag. You get a lot of choices regarding your meat and your bun, for example. Overall, I thought the food was good.  The unlimited sides and milkshakes is a bit of a joke because it'll take forever to get them and that's more food than anyone should be eating. Overall, I just didn't love this place because of the atmosphere. It has all the class of an Applebees.  I'd rather go to Red Cow for a burger at the same price with a much hipper/cleaner vibe.  I did really like how customizable the kid menu is. You get a lot of different choices for entrees and sides and some are even healthy!  Good luck getting your kid to eat unlimited fills of broccoli, however, when everyone else is eating burgers and fries.
Server was great! Came for the burgers though, and they were burnt. Like charred. All I could taste was char. Not impressed. The shakes are good though...

This place used to be really good. Not this visit. Apparently my name is difficult. The server asked me X3 what my name was and still after awhile didn't have my name on the wait list. Eek.  We were stuffed at a small booth. Luckily our little one fit in. Still crammed. With the onslaught of menus, the little mini ipad/pay station, seasonings and all the other hooey on the table, it made it pretty tight and packed. Food was ok. Took a loooooong time to come out. For what we ordered it should not have taken almost 50 min. Endless fries means endless wait times. Refills were pretty scarce. The mini ipad/pay station is a pain. Since when do we have to do our own check outs. Not to mention a 1.99 entertainment fee. Really? We didn't use that thing. Just really disappointed on this visit. Probably won't return in the near future.

This place is always very busy. When we went there tonight we sat at our table for over 20 minutes without waitstaff taking a drink order. We decided to leave. We spoke with the manager and not only was she very apologetic she paid for our meal, and our meal was out within minutes. Our waitress Katie K, was incredibly attentive and we never went more than 10 minutes without being checked on. This was over and beyond what they needed to do to fix the situation, and they were kind the entire time. What started as a not so happy Situation turned into a place that I will always recommend to people. Thank you.

My boyfriend and I went last Friday right during dinner rush, there was a wait- to be expected. But we grabbed a few spots at the bar and were promptly served. The bartender was one of the highlights of the experience. He was knowledgeable and offered great suggestions since I had never been before.  The food was also great, the fry portion was small, and at first I was bummed, until I learned that IT IS UNLIMITED FRIES. How could someone not love this place? Also when we ordered a beer we were asked "short, tall or extra large" ..... Extra large?! What  a cool option. We will be back :)
Food was GREAT although it was a little hard to eat the lettuce burger, It was delicious. The servers/workers were enthusiastic and I left happy.

All my life, I thought Red Robin was a fast food joint. You learn something new every day! While admittedly, it's miles from gourmet, the food was pretty damn good! Lots of selection for burgers, and more salads than a lot of places (I think there were 8 or 9?)! I had the Bonzai Salad, which was romaine with carrots and almonds and cabbage and teriyaki chicken, with a delightful ale vinaigrette. It felt ...heavy and left me feeling satisfied for the whole afternoon! When I got back to the office I looked up the nutrition and there were only 450ish calories. Including dressing! Whaaat! I think I just found my new guilty pleasure! Service was a little slower than I would have expected, for how few people were dining, I'd be nervous to see what it's like on an evening.

Incredibly loud.  This is apparently a thing that some kinds of restaurant think is attractive. They are wrong.  It just indicates their budget for sound deadening material is inadequate. The "bottomless fries" would be nice if the server ever came back to give you more of them.  The burger setups are quite good--shame that the burgers they put into them are mediocre.  It is also kind of expensive for what you're getting. I haven't been able to figure out why the parking lot is always full when you can cross 694 and go to Five Guys for better burgers, better fries, and less noise all at a lower price.  I've only gone twice since they opened so maybe they've gotten a lot better.  I will probably never find out, though.

Normally we enjoy this location, however our services tonight was very sub par. Overall slow service, slow drinks, slow food, no refills, and no box even when asked. We left with the rest of our food wrapped in napkins...  We witnessed other tables getting good service, sadly just not ours.  Two stars, because the food was good.

Ordered last Friday night,  take out.  My son forgot to check the order before leaving the restuarant because the bartender said that was it,  big mistake. Over half the order was missing!!! 1 burger no side or toppings, 1 burger correct, 1 burger completely missing.  Called to talk to manager she said she would credit account by Monday.  It's now Friday and nothing.  What a joke!

Our waitress seemed to do a lot of walking around looking busy; as far as checking in on us, she met the bare required check ins. The location was decently busy (but our waitress didn't appear to have many tables- we noticed two other tables with like two people). The food was spot on and the blended alcoholic beverage was on point!! I would recommend the place, as long as you're not a very needed eater as the wait staff we had was a little too busy looking with her Fitbit steps than checking on her customers.
I give zero stars. Poor management as I ask if they had nutritional guidelines of menu told me no I need go online, and then online don't work. Will never go again.

Great burgers, great service.. enjoyed eating there.  Floors were a little dirty, but they were busy so I can see that.  I was in a group of 9, so it took longer for our food to get there but the server was very attentative.  Will definitely eat there again.

My family took my son here for his birthday.  We arrived at 6pm; we didn't get to place our order until 635.  At 730pm, our food had still not gotten to our table.    We use to love to come here for a great meal. However. After this experience I don't think we will be back.  We ended up taking our food home to eat due to the fact that our son needed to be at work by 8pm. Sucks to eat your sit down food on the freeway heading to work.  They couldn't even get the bill right.

Red Robin is a great burger place. It's not gourmet but it's solid, and you get all you can eat steak cut fries! I have heard more than one person I've been with say that the burgers are sort of bland. This is true but it's because they don't salt the meat. Try this: Open your burger bun, take some of the house seasoned salt on the table and generously shake it on. Now try your burger. It makes a world of difference.  The place is way too packed and you'll wait over a 1/2 hour if you go at peak times so be prepared and forewarned.

Not so great tonight. We drive a very long way to come here, and usually have a great meal, but tonight was not one of them. They were busy, and we were seated at a red table that was in everyone's way. Our onion rings were not hot- I saw them sitting for a good 5 minutes, as I was facing the food window and very close up. Our server comped them. My whiskey river garden burger was totally greasy; I have had this at least 4 times but tonight it was gross. They put way too much mayo on typically, and my husband had the whiskey river chicken sandwich which was swimming in mayo as well. We really enjoy Red Robin, and will return, but tonight was not it's best effort.

After singing the jingle for years...Yummmm!, it was time to experience Red Robin. We wondered in around 7PM on a Thursday. The place was moderately full. It is a cross between an Applebees and Upscale hotel bar. Instantly greeted by a college boy. He sat us in the bar in front of the big screens airing hockey. He said that he would be there to help us if we needed it, but that Nessa would be our server. I will divided this review into four categories: 1 - Look and feel.  Four stars for clean, modern and inviting. 2 - Service was one star. While Nessa was great, she was overworked or overwhelmed by the number of tables she had to serve. Her smile was real, her insight for first timers was spot on and her attention after the food arrived and swiftly getting our check was excellent. Once we were seated it was 14 minutes before water was brought to the table. With the wings, there were no napkins or utensils. I asked the host and he brought over some napkins and forks, and said they were "out of knives". This was a new reply for me. Apparently Red Robin needs to cut back a bit on advertising and invest in some cutlery. The food did arrive quickly and hot.  3 - Food was four-five stars. Excellent. Impressive. While the wings are small (where do they find chickens that tiny?), they were perfectly cooked. We had bone-in plain batter with their BBQ and spin on buffalo sauce. So yummy. The homemade potato chips that are served with the wings are delicious. We will be back just for this appetizer. We shared the Royal Red Robbin Burger with endless steak fries. This burger had the over easy egg on it. Very good. The fries were awesome. Congrats to the kitchen staff for delivering great food.  4 - Other stuff: Beer list is ok, but no Grain Belt Premium on tap or bottles.  Parking is in a large stand alone lot. Bathrooms are clean. Large full service bar.  Overall a three, but if service improves, an easy four star experience.  We will be back when we have LOTS OF TIME to wait and we will be sure to be properly hydrated before entering. Food is that good.
Food was ok when it arrived.  Had to ask where our appetizer was and it was then delivered luke-warm.  They were busy but not unusually busy.  Burgers tasted good.

Under cooked burger.  Wimpy fries.  Seriously overpriced for what is a crappy drive-in burger.   You can get same thing, and sooner, and for $4.99 at Sonic.  Not that you want that either but you would be half less unhappy paying $5 - than paying $10.89 for a cold cheeseburger. Service?  Didn't  see it.   The beer was flat as well.
Good burger, but very messy. They advertise bottomless fries, but don't give you much to start off with. Had to ask the server for silverware, but overall decent experience.

The food is great, service is great, must have let the cleaning staff go when the new menus came out, this store needs a good cleaning from nasty ceiling fans and vents right over your food, to the urine soaked walls of the bathroom, Going to  Plymouth store from now on.

Its cold up here in Minnesoooota. I am not winterized like many that live here, and on this occasion, I left my wallet in my other heavy  jacket.  So, when the bill came.. I was patting down myself and reached for no wallet... OMG  I told the bartender, who was very understanding and let me go back to the hotel to retrieve my wallet. No hassle, no big deal, did not even blink an eye..  I came back in 5 minutes, left a huge tip, thank ful that this embarrasing episode is kept under control. Many thanks again to the bartender.

I went here with the family for the first time over the weekend and I am stumped as to why this place is always full. I wasn't feeling that need to pound down a burger, so I ordered some Game Day Nachos instead. I think that's where I went wrong. These had to be the worst nachos I've ever had. Fake cheese is never good on nachos. The chips were so salty, I could only eat about four before calling it quits. About the only thing half good on the nachos was the presentation. The atmosphere is very busy and loud with kids all around. It almost gives it a chaotic feel. But hey, at least they are kid friendly and the service was alright too. I was happy to leave this place and probably won't be back.

Bottomless root beer floats bottle less fries and phenomenal burgers. Never had a bad experience at RR and this is no different maybe even best one so far. I've eatin at RR's in three 4 states and this one has out done them all. Thank you

Met a friend for lunch here today.  Got there about 11:40a...No wait....YEAH!!  Had a good server.  We dined because we had the Red Royalty offer of BOGO50%.  We both ordered the Smoked Pepper....strayed from our normal Whiskey River BBQ and some Chili burger.  The burger was FANTASTIC!!  I just re-heated it...phenomenal!!  As we went to pay at the table, she informed our server the discount didn't come off.... Apparently RR has Gourmet and Fine Gourmet burgers....who pays attention to the categories?!  :) The difference IS....the Fine are 1/2 lb burgers rather than 1/3 lb.... Neither of us finished ours, which is the norm, so it wasn't indicative of the bigger burger...sorry.  So the gal said she would have to talk to the manager.  As we waited for him to come to our table...already set ourselves up for the No......  The gal came back with the check and the manager just took the discount off!!  THANK YOU!!  Rather than quibble with patrons over a few $ difference he took care of it.  Alleviating any issues.  THANK YOU Red Robin, looking forward to my next tasty burger from a friendly staff!!
Felt 100% before going.  Had severe nausea and stomach pain only 1 hour after. Then severe vomiting only an hr later.  Still very sick several hours after going.

I love the food and haven't really had bad service but don't ever get the sangria.  They run it on special and I'm not sure why? Maybe because it's awful. It tasted like they put red wine over ice and just threw fruit in.  It was nothing like the description and nothing like any sangria I've ever had.  Should be called wine on ice with added fruit slices.

This place has pretty good food! They offer gluten free options. The portions are huge, so the prices are reasonable. Our food was served within minutes of ordering. I even had some yummy leftovers to take with me.

First time at Red Robins and I would have to say this is a place to come and have drinks and eat burgers! Had a party of two and ordered the Love BG, Banzai BG, root beer float, and freckle lemonade. Didn't know drinks were bottomless so they just kept coming. Food was very decent sized and tasted good. Onion rings were pretty good for appetizers. Service was excellent! Waitress was on point. Very friendly, had good knowledge of what's in the food and very attentive when drinks were low. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for good food and great service!

Our favorite.   Lots of variety, all of which is good.   I like the A1 burger, the BBQ burger, the Tavern Double, the Smoke and Pepper burger, the fish and chips, etc, etc.   You really can't go wrong.    The endless fries are good but I can usually only eat one helping because they give you plenty the first time. Service is fast and friendly. There's plenty of room in the parking lot but there's always a bunch of cars parked on the street in front of this place.   Why are they parked there?   Where did they go?

I've eaten here plenty of times with different experiences good and bad in food, staff, wait times, etc. This review is based on my experience from yesterday. We got there around 4:30ish and was seated right away. It didn't take long for our waitress to come out. It wasn't that busy at that point. Our drinks that weren't made at the bar came out quickly. My mom's pickled pear lemonade took longer but a plain vanilla shake for my five year old took over 20 minutes to get. The appetizer and the meals themselves took long enough to come out as well probably due to how busy it was at the restaurant. I was concerned since people who had arrived after us got drinks and appetizers before us. They messed us the burger my mom ordered and offered to fix it and not charge us for it. The Red Robin rewards are nice to since every so often we'll get a free burger which we did last night. The burgers are decent, gourmet...no. Overall I'll eat there again since the burgers are tasty, the garlic aioli sauce it bomb, and can't beat bottomless fries.

I have to imagine they've changed management or something, because this place used to be great, but now I don't think we're ever going back. We visited 2 nights ago and, big surprise, just like last time they were extremely short on cutlery. to the point where I had to ask for some and was given less than what we needed and was told sorry they're short and we got the last of it. (same thing happened our last visit.. and the one before that..) At least this time the service was good. The waitress was nice but was quite busy due to it being dinner rush. My food was warm, but not cooked properly. My boca burger was just simply heated, honestly I wouldn't be shocked if they microwaved it.

I recently dined here for the first time. I like the idea of several burger selections. I mean, its a good restaurant. The problem is it does not stand out from the norm in my opinion. There are so many restaurants around that serve this type of food these days. I am not saying the food is bad, I mean they make a great burger, and there are a lot of different choices, but not outstanding as far as I'm concerend. If you ever get a chance to eat here, give it a try, but don't be too surprised if you've experienced something similar in the past.

We have been coming to RR for the past 9 years. It's a great place to have a really good burger and bottomless steak fries. Our boys can't get enough of their bottomless root beer floats. We love the Burnin' Love Burger. Try the Ghost pepper sauce on the side if you like things heated up a notch. They give out free balloons to the kids and sing a song for you if its your birthday. If you are into a full bar and beer on tap; they have that too. Overall it's a great place for a burger. For the vegan and vegetarian folks, they substitute a Boca burger for any of their burgers. I especially love that they offer a free burger and fries to veterans on Veterans' Day.

Sign up for the rewards program! it's worth it! My burger today was 50% off. The burgers are pretty good and service is pretty good considering I went at lunch and the parking lot was so full I wondered if it was completely full at first. I think next time I'll go later in the day.

Horrible service!! Came in for dinner, place is well over half empty. Took them a out 10 minutes to notice we were standing by the door waiting to be seated. Another 10 minutes before a drink order was taken. No silverware, no napkins...2 waters for 3 people. Fries under cooked. I have learned my lesson.
This was my first time at this location and it sucked!  The waitress was slow. Didn't get silverware or napkins. Poor service.. Never will come back.

"Miles" to go... While I enjoy the food here, I have to say our service this time was terrible. Miles strolled up to the table and called my fiance "boss" - immediate no-no. It took forever for our drinks to arrive, and my mom's sandwich didn't arrive with the correct bread because Miles neglected to tell her that they were out. Are all of these things understandable? Sure. But you see, a GOOD server will stop by your table and let you know some of these things -- "Hey, I'm really sorry, it looks like the bar is short-staffed. Might take a little longer to get your drinks."  Or, "Just to let you know, we're out of the ciabatta. Is a regular bun okay, or did you want to look at ordering something else?" He never actually stopped at our table after the food was delivered. He just breezed by and asked if everything was okay, never actually waiting for an answer before he moved on. Very unprofessional. As a person that formerly worked in the restaurant business, I thought to myself, 'Shouldn't that kind of hospitality be commonplace for a server?' Yet Miles didn't do any of these things. Hence why he ended up with a collective tip from the 3 of us, of less than 5%. Get Miles out of there, and hire quality staff please, that know how to wait tables. And if you, the reader, have the misfortune of being seated in his section, ask for a new server right away. Your experience will be all the better for it.

My friends and Co-workers were on a trip to Red Robin on a monthly trip to a restaurant and a trip to the Shoreview Target store to do a walk through. (We all work at Target HQ) We had about 8 of us there and I was the only one to order a Southwest Chicken Salad, which was awesome. The chicken was perfectly cooked, nice and juicy with a wonderful bed of lettuce and some fried jalepeno on the side. I finished it all, but it could easily be a salad for two. There nice slices of avacado and they gave me my dressing on the side, awesome. Everyone else got a burger and everyone seemend to like it. They had fries coming on whenever you wanted it and my Diet Coke was refilled on a solid pace. I tried a couple sweet potatoe fries and they were very nice with the saltiness mixing with the sweetness of the sweet potatoe. My salad was about 8 minutes later than all the other dishes, so a co-worker said that it was a lot later than everyone, so they comped me the salad. (I made sure to tip the servers, because it wasn't their fault) but the classiness of the business to reconize something that went wrong goes a long way. They had no idea that I was a big Yelper, so their big step up to make things right really went a long way. The place was packed at lunch time, so they must be doing something right. The salad was amazing and they were first class gives the place a 5 star!

The food is delicious. The service is fast and friendly. The prices are reasonable.  I recently complained via RR's website that they haste no changing table in their men's restroom, only in the women's. They promptly installed one and called to tell me, to apologize, and to offer me a free appetizer on my next visit. Now THAT is customer oriented business. Good job.

Went with a group of co-workers and was a pretty decent time.  I never knew there was a red robin in Minnesota and when I found out I had to go.  We went at around mid-day and it was fairly slow.  -Our waiter asked what we wanted for drinks. Me and one friend got a Dr pepper and I got a root beer. The waiter had switched them up by mistake which I can see happening easily.  -The waiter then got our orders and had brought out the food and had brought out the wrong one for my friend. He corrected it and said he was sorry.  -We hardly got asked how the meal was or if we needed anything else. We got our refills when needed but other then that nothing.  -We paid our bills and on the way out our waiter didn't bat an eye towards us or even said have a good day or thanks for coming.  Food was excellent but the waiter that waited on us needs to improve a little.

I give Red Robin 5 stars because of the vegetarian burger option. They have boca and gardenburger.  The boca burger has a smoke flavor and a nice texture, a good vessel for the "burger" toppings. I have never understood why all restaurants that serve burgers do not always offer a boca burger in place of beef.  You just keep them in the freezer until someone orders.  I HATE black bean burgers because of the seasonings; if I want cumin and taco flavors, I'll go to a Mexican restaurant and order tacos...   So, in my opinion, other burger joints should lose the black bean burger and just stock the boca burgers. For us, the service has always been average to above average.  Nothing to complain about. I do like their sides options.  If you don't want their bottom-less steak fries (and who wouldn't), they do have a side salad, steamed broccoli, sweet potato fries, and a bunch of others as options.
Horrible service tonight, could not be slower and never asked how we were doing, no napkins, just tertible

I'm not sure what I miss that others really appreciate about this place.  The dining room is pretty uninspiring, the wait-staff seem friendly enough but also seem like they're in training and the food is average at best, slightly below average more often than not. The bar's okay but nothing to write home about. And the prices seem high given the dining experience and the quality of the food. My three favorite places for hamburgers are Blue Door, Groveland Tap and the Nook/Shamrock. Food quality is far better, IMO. Ambience is quirkier, reflecting the independent ownership vs corporate-dictated decorating. Prices actually seem slightly lower. The wait-staff are always great and know what they're doing and what's working (or not) in the kitchen or at the tap. Yeah, it takes me 10-15 minutes longer to drive there and parking at those places isn't as convenient. But to my tastes, those are minor inconveniences for a much better burger and beer experience.

I'm not huge on chain restaurants, so I had never tried Red Robin before this past weekend when some friends suggested meeting for lunch.  This place is pretty big, and the service was great. The menu is very extensive so everyone should be able to find something that suits their fancy. I'm not a red-meat eater, so I steered clear of all of the burger options. After reading a review on Yelp, I decided to try the Whiskey River Chicken wrap with a cup of chicken tortilla soup. The wrap had really nice flavor from the BBQ sauce and ranch, but the chicken was not very hot... The soup I would definitely not order again. It tasted like it was from a can and the flavor was overpowered by too much cumin. We started our meal with the pretzel bites. I was super pumped to try these, because who doesn't like a pretzel with cheese sauce?? Unfortunately, the cheese sauce was not great, it was a little thick and goupy. I  preferred the whole-grain mustard sauce. There was something different about the pretzels themselves, they almost tasted deep fried... I prefer a traditional pretzel, I don't need the extra fat and grease.

Egg was raw.  My husband went in for takeout and got me the Royal Red Robin, and the fried egg was raw.  Not just an over-easy raw yolk.  We're talking slimy clear wiggly raw egg white.  How hard is it to fry an egg?  So gross.  The burger itself wasn't bad, but the egg seriously ruined it.
Amazing burgers, and very charming service. The strawberry lemonade tasted great. So did the burgers. I had the Berserk burger, their newest treat. Prices are still OK here, too.

I frequent this restaurant whenever me and my friend jenny are craving a good burger. The servers are very polite and friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. However we went yesterday 3/2/2015 and it did take quite a long time to receive our burgers. We had the pretzel bites which were really good! I wish they would have given us more though seeing as there were 3 of us at our table. A good thing about this place is you get endless fries! ENDLESS!!!!! I had the sweet potato fries which were really good dipped in ranch. I had the Whiskey River Burger which was delicious... it was oozing with BBQ goodness and lots of bacon. I definitely recommend this place if you want to chow down on a good piece of meet.

Hey, the bottomless steak fries are great-ask them to leave off the 'Red Robin' spice.  The server was effective in a hurried, friendly but impersonal style.  The place was very busy for early on a Thursday night.  The menu is bewildering with plenty of add ons available.  Toll:  $50 for three burger meals, one beverage (a beer) and one appetizer.  Yikes.   But what about the burgers? It's a burger place, I have to talk about the 'gourmet' burgers right?   Ok, here's my take on the burgers.  Less beef than I remember, less beef/burger flavor, more food service bun, more cheese, food service bacon-the salty transparent kind you can almost see through. My old favorite the royal red robin burger (topped with a fried egg) has declined.   The burger competition around town is tough.  Red Robin burgers are going in the wrong direction and value is questionable.  Better consider a name change to Gourmet Steak Fries....and burgers.
Busy fried food Nirvana. You get get extra fries for the asking. What's not to like?  Can be a little hectic so don't go if you want calm.

Yesterday I felt the call of the potato. I love fries, but I have a particular soft spot for steak fries doused in salt. Red Robin has giant flippers of fries and yep, they're salty and hot.  I tend to order the fancy burgers with the garden burger or chicken since I'm not a total masochist with the bottomless fries and my cholesterol. I used to get the Banzai burger every time, but got tired of the cheese, mayo and sauce turning the burger into a mushy handful. Esp with the garden burger which just seemed to dissolve into  food fight fodder. I tried the bruschetta chicken sandwich last time and was pretty impressed. I hate tomatoes (shhh) but I love balsamic so found the glaze and ciabatta roll saved the sandwich. Last night I tried the A1 Peppercorn with the garden burger. There was a little snafu with the kitchen not getting the *keep* the bacon message, but our server quickly brought out the missing slices. It was very peppercorny (yes I know. the hint was in the name and a little saltier than I like). We went for an early dinner so the place was quieter than usual and our server pretty attentive. Probably helped he had a shadow, but no complaints.

Big burger, good steak fries (all you can eat I guess?).  Stopped in with  group for lunch for work.  The burgers were all cooked to the right temp; service was good.  They kept our drinks full and were quick.  Everything was good. Sure we will go back again at some point.
ordered the southwestern chx salad to go..menu said pre tossed in dressing. Salad came with no dressing.

I don't get it.  I don't get why so many people are raving about this place on here?  Shills?  I stopped in the other night for the first time and in a nutshell here was my experience: A.  Ordered their self proclaimed signature cheeseburger.  It was average.  I've had better burgers at a multitude of joints around the TC.  Most of those joints aren't even concentrating on burgers like this place professes.   And the kicker, the burger was EXPENSIVE.  For a mediocre burger I will not pay these prices. B.  Where was the great service so many rave about?  The menu said I got free refills on my steak fries.   The waitress did not return to my table (it was 8 pm, not busy) until I was finished eating.  That means my water didn't get refilled, nor my fries.  This is great service.  Oh, when she dropped off the food she literally returned 15 seconds later to ask how the food was.  I hadn't even tried it yet.  "looks good" ?? That was the last I saw of her for the next 20 minutes.  Correction, I did see her having a great chat with the apparently dreamy bartender while she neglected me, her customer, the one paying the tip.  C.  The Steak Fries.  Whats the big deal?  Could it be the four tons of salt mix they put on them?  Cuz other than that they ain't all that.  Add the salt and BOOM! you have fries you could eat that night or maybe even 6 months from now, because they've been PRESERVED!  As you can tell I was not impressed with this joint.  If I'm paying I doubt I'll be back. Overpriced mediocrity.

Ok, the food was fantastic. This earned them a well deserved 4 stars and an opportunity to try again.  The burning love chicken sandwich was great, and the kid loved her pepperoni pizza. To be honest it's the first time I have seen her like pizza from a non-pizza place. (But she orders them anyhow)

Stopped by on a Monday night for a quick chicken sandwich. Ordered and waited just over 30 minutes before walking out. While waiting, listened to the very overwhelmed bartender complain about being short staffed/by herself. Upon leaving, mentioned to the manager my experience, and suggested she get the bartender some help. She told me she was short staffed all over the restaurant...told her that problem was going to take care of itself, as customers will leave and not come back. Went to Green Mill nearby. Same food/better service.

Horrible service! Fries were served cold and we finished our burgers by the time they brought out hot ones. Should have known when even the hostess was bad. We'll never be back to this poorly managed location.
This place is the best!! I love the variety of burgers, but had a hard time settling on just one. I will definitely be back to try more burger combinations

The Royal Red Robin Burger - basic california burger with bacon, but also topped with a fried egg! Order with the yolk still runny, best ever! Would have given 5th star, however, requests for runny yolk are hit or miss, I have ordered a number of times this way, but have only received it once.

Yup! I'm a fan. Went here a couple days ago right at dinner time. I went with a group of 5 and the hostess told me the wait to be seated would be an hour. I knew that was a stretch so we decided to take the challenge. It ends up we made the right choice as we were seated in around 15 minutes! I will say that it was loud with fellow dinners but it wasn't a problem for our group. We ordered a wide variety of mainly burger dishes and everyone liked the meals they ordered. the 5 of us eat for around $60.00 so for great burgers and lots of beers, sodas and shakes for $60.00 I'd say a great value. I recommend.

What a nice staff on the day I was there!  Helpful, accommodating and kind!! Not fine dining but good food at ok prices.  My big problem is the noise level!  Way too loud for any conversation with other members of my party!!!

Nothing says happy birthday better than meat and cheese. My husband's birthday and my birthday are three days apart and as email members of Red Robin's birthday club, we each receive a coupon around the same time every year for a free burger and fries--the only thing you pay for is your beverage.  You also receive a complementary sundae and unless you LIKE clapping and singing, you can usually opt out of the usual dog and pony show if your server isn't a tool (and since they haven't received their tip yet, chances are good they'll do whatever you ask).   We found ourselves at the location in Plymouth recently while waiting for our second car to come out of the shop.  It was one of those days where it was snowing {again}, it was an hour and a half past lunch, both adults were "hangry" and even more critical, Toddler F. was also wet, hungry and desperate to get out of her car seat.  We'd been driving around aimlessly until we turned a corner and saw the Red Robin.  Hello, lifesaver!  When all was said and done, 2 enormous burgers w/fries + 2 sodas + 1 kid meal of mac & cheese, steamed broccoli and milk + tip = about $41.  And lifesaver or no, that's not exactly a deal.   This week, also known as birthday week at the F. house, we went to the Shoreview location because it is closer to home where 2 enormous burgers w/fries + no soda (NY resolutions) + 1 kid meal of mac & cheese, steamed broccoli and milk + 2 sundaes + tip = about $12 (remember to tip on the full value of the meal, yo!)  And that *is* a deal!   Until the little one came along, I'd never paid close attention to the décor or RR flair but my munchkin LOVES the carousel horses mounted in the dining area.  RR also has balloons near the hostess stand and when we walked into the entry my kid immediately began flirting with the young woman at the hostess stand and earned a pink RR balloon for her efforts which provided entertainment during the meal, the car ride home and at home as well.  Family friendliness is an important factor for me these days so I appreciated the gesture.   Over the past several years, I would guesstimate my attendance to RR at around 15 visits and most of the time the food is consistently pretty good.  Occasionally it is really good and one time it was not so great which I guess is how it goes at these kinds of places.   I'm having a hard time deciding between a rating because the cost of the food generally has an impact on how I'd rate the experience.   4 stars = free RR burger 3 stars = full price RR burger Overall I'm going to go with three.

This review is only useful in comparison to other chain burger places.  I just can't bring myself to give it a 4 (3.5).  All you can eat fries and a cajun chicken sandwich which was actually spicy (in Minnesota)!!

Bottomless steak fries are a perk. And the onion rings are enormous and pretty tasty. I usually come here for lunch as they have a very good BLTA croissant and their California chicken sandwich is unique as they add an avocado salsa to it. Tortilla soup is pretty good too. Must try their freckled lemonade. My son is hooked on it. Service is usually good. This is a very loud restaurant.

When we arrived on late Sunday morning, they had trouble seating us because they were short staffed.  Outside of this one-off event, great service. Red Robin has a variety of burgers, all of which are excellent.  The selling point on this place is the bottomless basket of steak fries.  Steak fries!  STEAK FRIES!

Oh Mother of Mary! I can't stress enough of how much I love Red Robin!  I am a member of Red Robin's e-club which means you get a free burger on your birthday (actually the coupon extends within two weeks of your actual birthday). You should sign up! My husband and myself have been frequenting the Red Robin in Shorview for the past three years (ever since the Eagan location was torn down for a Best Buy...boo). I've had the Chili Chili Cheeseburger which is a cheeseburger served open faced with Chipotle mayo, Cheddar cheese, diced red onions and topped with chili. Yum! I remember it being messy and I couldn't finish it, but I had leftovers for the next day. I have also tried the Banzai Burger which is a teriyaki burger that is topped with grilled pineapple, Cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomatoes and mayo. This is probably my favorite that I have tried at Red Robin. The photo that is attached to this posting is the Guacamole Bacon Burger which included guacamole, bacon, swiss cheese, onions, lettuce, tomatoes and mayonnaise. Note : They will cook your burger with "some pink" or "no pink"...I always order my burgers with "some pink" and I've been pleasantly surprised that a chain will do this.
Terrible service! 3 strikes in a row and you are out. We will not be spending any more time or money there. It's just not worth it.

Red Robin is a favorite spot for coworkers to celebrate birthday lunches, and we recently went again. I was bored. Not that there isn't a lot going on there, what with the 16 widescreen tvs, overhead 80s music, and "Flingers" style decor. But, I realized of all the great places in the Cities, why was I wasting my time at the "same old, same old"? I always order the Whiskey River BBQ burger, and that is fine, but it is not as good as the Bedda Chedda burger at Granite City. Maybe it's just that I need to open up to new menu items. Maybe my coworkers need to have more interesting conversations. Whatever it is, I think Red Robin is just a'it".

This restaurant does have good burgers, as well as some menu options for those who might want something else. What I do find slightly irritating is the amount of attention they think they have to give you. It is not unusual to be asked if you need anything by at least three different people. I'm not sure why some places feel that frequent interruptions to your lunch conversations are an essential part of a positive customer experience. Get my drink order, get my good order, refill my drink without asking me, and I'm a happy camper.
Burgers are ok but nothing spectacular. I love the bottomless fries, however. So yummy!

Well, it's a Red Robin.  Like many other Red Robins.  The service here is usually very good.  No complaints.  However, being out in the burbs the place is filled to the rims with screaming kids almost every evening. So, if you're planning on going, head out there after 8:30pm. Ample selections of burgers that can be easily customized. However, being as it is in Minnesota, they don't know what hot is.  I ordered the five alarm burger and told them to make it extra spicy. I was warned it was already really hot (it isn't, I've had it before) and they couldn't do much besides add in some extra jalapenos.  That added some heat, but it's about as much as they can do. They keep updating the menu with interesting burger options, so if you only go back once every couple of months you should be able to find something new and interesting every time you visit. Also, freckled lemonade for the win.

****If you are going to put a "Veggie Burger" on your menu, KNOW HOW TO COOK IT!!******** Now as a chef that has worked in all kinds of kitchen, I am well aware of the attitude that some chefs have about vegetarians and making anything for them. My problem here is that if you are going to call yourself "the home of the burger" and offer a Boca Burger on you menu, at lest know how to cook it, and don't send it out wrong TWICE, after being told it was only microwaved and not cooked by the customer! If you are not going to commit to doing it right, don't do it at all! We ordered a "Veggie Burger" for my vegetarian partner and it was grey! It had been thawed in the microwave, and then just put in a bun and served to her. It wasn't even hot! When we pointed this out and sent it back, they sent us another one done in the same way. When I asked the Manager to describe how the burger was made, she described a method (from frozen to a microwave, then on the "flat top") that was not the way the kitchen prepared it. When I said again, that I an a chef and could tell that it was not prepared properly, no corrective action was taken. The attitude was "Oh Well". For the price, I could make it better myself, (and have). My issue here is that it the chef can't commit to making something as simple as a Boca Burger right, why even have it on the menu? Why waste the time and effort to do it wrong twice! It was an insult and I will not go back!

Went last night with two small children.  We arrived at 4:30, before dinner rush.  Just note. .. They had more than 10 empty tables but preferred to have guests crammed into the entryway rather than seated due to "being short staffed. "  I would accept this excuse once(people get sick,  emergencies happen), but it has happened twice in a row for us. Hire more staff for the weekend.  Mac and cheese for kids was good,  sides for kid meals were too small but they have bottomless milk and chocolate milk with kids meals.  No one does that! In addition our food sat waiting to be delivered for a long time.  It was actually cold when it came.   Took us an hour and a half to eat and we arrived before the dinner rush was in full swing.  Took way too long for my preschoolers.   They were so restless by the end. (And due to a huge crowd in the entry,  there was no where to let my toddler walk while the others finished eating. )Other than food being cold,  everything was done correctly and tasted fine.  Wendy the server did great.    Probably won't be back anytime soon.   Wouldn't recommend to families with small children.
I love RR. Only wish there was one closer. Good service. Freckled lemonade and chophouse burger were great. Fun. This was my free birthday burger. Great deal! Made this visit even better.
Gotta love their unlimited Fries! They have huge onion rings... Fun place for family nights. Love their Jalapeno Burger and Strawberry Lemonade!

I meet a friend of mine up here from time to time and am always happy with the food and service.  We try to beat the lunch rush and get in a few minutes before noon and we chat through lunch.  Our service is always friendly, fast and accurate.  They are happy to refill our drinks and let us enjoy our lunch without ever rushing us out to "turn" tables. I checked in on FourSquare and received a coupon to boot!

Love that egg on the burger. The Royal Red Robin was the first burger I had with a fried egg on top. Of course now I've had plenty of similar burgers in other restaurants, but I'll always have fond memories of the first that popped my egg burger cherry. I believe there are only two or three in the entire metro area so finding one of these burger chains nearby maybe difficult. It may be worth it to some people to travel for those unlimited fries that come with every burger though. Unfortunately for me, I'm usually too full after the burger to order another round of those fries (one of these days, it will happen)!  They do have pretty good onion rings as well. It comes out on a giant cone with a couple sauces and it's not an uncommon starter to have right away. Overall, they are not bad in my book!

Red Robin is a nice place to have a burger with the family. They have a nice variety of burgers and endless french fries. Their burgers are above average and one of the better choices on this end of town. Lots of families with kids and a loud room. Service is prompt and consistently good. Great place to cure that burger fix.

We've eaten at this Red Robin twice now, and we love their food.  I always leave satisfied. The burnin love burger is my favorite! It's not too spicy, but it has just the perfect zing to it. However, the service here isn't anything to write home about.  Our waitress today was very slow and seemed a little snotty. Other than that, no complaints

For a chain, my hubby & I have a pretty great love for Red Robin.  I've been to many of their stores and really haven't had a bad experience.  Saturday lunch was no exception. Our family of 3 went to celebrate daughter's birthday (she's 2) with a casual lunch before nap time.  She could probably honestly care less where we ended up so this was more of a mom & dad pick.  She had the kids cheeseburger with apple slices.  I really like that there is a good selection of sides for the kids meals.  Most places it's fries or yogurt.  Here its fries, oranges, apples slices, broccoli, and like 2 other things. I had the Blue Ribbon Burger and Hubby had the Luau.  The luau was pretty standard.  He's a communist who hates condiments so it only had the teriyaki sauce on it.  My burger was good though I had a hard time finding the blue cheese under all that chipolte mayo at first.  The fries were fine as usual. My standard is the Whiskey River Chicken Wrap and I probably should have stayed with that.  I love the flavor and the crunch of the tortilla strips in the wrap.  There was nothing wrong with my burger but I love the wrap for a reason. Also, Red Robin himself was there which daughter got a kick out of.  She kind of stalked him all around the restaurant.

This is the second of my post-birthday reviews and yes, I concede this is a chain review (see my disclaimer below). Red Robin is a burger joint.  They have a few unique "flavors" of burgers as well as the classics and they are all good, tasty, and huge.  Their steak fries aren't that much better than fries from a freezer case--until you add their seasoning salt.  Then they taste much better.  Plus, the fries are all-you-can-eat, so you can indulge yourself as much as you want. But the reason for this review is for two specific menu items.  The first is their onion rings.  They come stacked in a tower like one of those baby ring toys with two sauces.  One is a ranch sauce and the other is one that I would describe to you if I had any talent in describing tastes.  Just believe me when I say it's yummy. The other menu item I love at RR is their freckled lemonade.  It's pink lemonade with cut up strawberries in it.  I'm not a huge fan of instant lemonade, but it's taken to a whole 'nother level when you add fresh strawberries to it.  It's pricey at $3.99, but it's bottomless and I drink as much as I can when I'm there. Since I was there on my birthday, I got a free ice cream and hot fudge  dessert with a pile of whip cream.  RR is one of those places that chooses to embarrass you with clapping and singing at your table as penance for your dessert, but I was fortunate that there were an extraordinary number of those last night and by the time they got to me, our waiter just handed the dessert to me and said, "happy birthday." The dinner topped off a fun evening with my family and I can't complain about a greasy, sloppy, artery-clogging meal. ----- Chain review disclaimer:  I won't do 'em.  You can't make me.  Well, ok.  Yes, you can.  But not easily.  I've sworn off chain reviews because chains are supposed to be the same wherever you go.  That's the beauty of a chain restaurant.  So I'll only do a review if there is something out of the norm for a chain, or the particular location.  This will happen if there is something unique, if they are extraordinarily good, or extraordinarily bad.
A little expensive, but one of my favorite comfort food places.
This place is kind of terrible. I haven't been in a couple years because the food was so undelicious the first time I went.

Stop by once in a while for a burger. Nothing fantastic, but good portions, tasty seasoned fries and decent service. Nice place to relax. Have never found it to be overly busy but maybe I've always hit the down times. Not bad, not great, just a middle of the road chain restaurant.

First time I've eat Red Robins.  Was very impressed.  Since I'm a vegetarian, I ordered their veggie burger.  It was one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had.  The fries were also excellent.  Also great service.  I would def eat here again.

I went there 2 weeks ago and ordered a double cheeseburger. It was cold. I had to send it back. It was cold again. They messed it up twice. The only good thing about Red Robin is there refillable steak fries. They were the only part of my meal that was hot. They also told me this "The smaller patties will tend to get colder faster.".I wish that she would have told me that sooner. The Manager tries to get me to order something else. Like the Half pounder. I think. What are the chances they'll mess it up again? 100% in my opinion.

Yes, I know this is a chain and all chains are bad (according to some), but as a vegetarian I can't say that I've had a better garden burger anywhere else!  They even have two options for meatless patties, a Boca burger type (more meaty) and a Garden Burger (more grainy).  My personal preferrence is the Garden burger patty. I get the 5-alarm burger with the Garden Burger patty and my wife always gets the Whisky River BBQ burger with the same; both of us swear ours is the bets.  The fries are really good and their salt seasoning is pretty good too.  We travel with a full crew (four kids) and it's a great place for families. If loving their (veggie) burgers makes me a sell out, plant a SOLD sign on me!
Good burgers and great endless seasoned fries.  Very busy, but still very good service.  Had their burger on special, $5.99 with fries, a steal!

Red Robin is like that comfy sweatshirt you wear on the weekend after a long week of business suits. Its a place where you can get good burgers and fries and sit back and relax with your friends without worrying about things like calories, vegetables, and oh-so-fancy silverware.  I had the Bayou burger, and it was exactly what I hoped for: excellent roasted peppers and onions on a burger that was cooked to order with a decent bun. On top of that, the fries were not bad and came as a bottomless basket.  I cannot give this place a five because of the price. I know good burgers can cost me, but it still feels like they are padding it for the gimmick. Its like buying the Abercrombie sweatshirt when there are plenty of other options. Still, this place is fun and relaxing. And if you need some bottomless fries and a good burger, this is definitely the place to go.
